wikipedia_page.main: Michael Richard Gratwicke Earls-Davis (21 February 1921 − 5 April 2016) was an English cricketer who played for Cambridge University in 1947 and for Somerset in 1950. He was born at Hampstead, London.

link_mentions.page: List of Somerset County Cricket Club players

response: Outside of cricket he worked as a doctor, and for a while lived in the United States, where he played cricket for the Philadelphian cricket team in the Halifax Cup. K. S. Duleepsinhji later lived with Heasman in Eastbourne while qualifying to play for Sussex. He died at Eastbourne, Sussex on 24 January 1934. His grandson Michael Earls-Davis also played first-class cricket.
